column1: Ent-houses were the homes of the Ents
column2: which seem to have been as varied in nature as the Ents themselves. Some were relatively large and complex
column3: while others were quite basic in nature. One thing that all Ent-houses had in common was a source of fresh water
column4: from which the Ents made the Ent-draughts that were their only sustenance.

column1: Treebeard maintained several Ent-houses in Fangorn Forest
column2: with the one at Wellinghall including a tree-lined courtyard
column4: and a rocky bay with a curtain of falling water.

column1: Other Ent-houses were rather less ornate: that of Quickbeam
column3: consisted of nothing more than a flat stone surrounded by rowan-trees.
